basics.name: William London Thompson
basics.label: Dr. London Thompson
basics.summary: Experienced educator with a Doctor of Education in Educational Leadership and Management, specializing in Athletic Administration. Proficient in academic leadership, program development, and research. Committed to fostering inclusive learning environments and promoting equity and diversity.

education.institution: Harvard Business School/Harvard Graduate School of Education

education.area: Educational Leadership and Management, concentration Athletic Administration

education.institution: The University of Hawai'i at Manoa
The University of Hawai'i - West O'ahu

work.summary: Department of Education, Doctor of Philosophy in Educational Management (PhD) program
Education and Communication, College of Social and Behavioral Sciences

Advised the development of a DEI and Justice Doctoral Fellowship. Conducted research to enhance the experiences of all students in higher education institutions. Designed and implemented data collection methods, including surveys, interviews, and focus groups. Analyzed and interpreted research findings, providing actionable recommendations. Mentored graduate students in their research projects, resulting in successful publication.

leadership.summary: Leadership and Vision, Research and Program Development, Operational Management, Client Engagement and Services Delivery

Grant Management, Program Development, Communication and Outreach, Student Support and Development, Evaluation and Assessment, Collaboration and Partnerships, Problem solving and Decision Making, Compliance and Ethics, Professional Development
Strategic Leadership, Intellectual Community Building, Advocacy and Representation
Recruitment, Onboarding and Compliance, Teacher Development, Professional Growth Oversight, Teacher Preparation Expertise, Inclusive Learning Environments

leadership.organization: Commuter Services, University of Hawaii at Manoa

serviceAndOutreach.organization: Faculty Committee for Student life, Drexel University
Drexel Emerging Graduate Scholars Committee, Drexel University

publications.title: Unmasking Barriers, Unleashing Potential: A Phenomenological Study on Academic Advisors' Implementation of Critical Support Systems for Black Male Student Athletes' Academic Success
The Recruit: A Futurist Story about Race and College Admissions

presentations.event: Dr. Penny L. Hammrich Doctoral Student Colloquium
